data.title: Best Korean Restaurant in Evansville
data.text:
I honestly don't know if there are any other Korean Restaurants in Evansville but I will tell you this place has been a mainstay over the decades in the Downtown area.  The food is fresh and consistent every single time.  I have always loved the dishes that I have eaten.  I have tried just about every dish on the menu. She definitely has the very best Hot & Sour Soup anywhere. Several years ago they added a Sushi Bar.  I have never tried it but I hear good things.

I love that the restaurant is in a location that years ago was the well known F's Steakhouse.  Jaya has preserved the original dining room as it was when I was a kid.  She uses the room for private parties and overflow.  What a treat to take this step back in time.

data.title: Lunch visit
data.text:
This a downtown sushi place. We came at noon during lunch hour which was semi busy. 
Food has been decent here but service still needs improvement. When you set at dirty table and ask waiter to clean it but keep on forgetting or forgets to bring dishes & napkins, either something was on his mind or just need to say see ya. 
During lunch people are limited on time & can't set there wondering if we get service. 
Other than that our sushi was good.

data.title: Great Sushi + Dishes
data.text: I love the Jaya's roll. All the dishes are great. They have a great Korean bibimbop dish! And to top it off, Jaya herself might just be your server.

data.title: Korean Delight
data.text: Friday late morning found us here for an early lunch. Ordered egg rolls which are freshly made at Jaya's, pot stickers,and edamame. All three were delicious. We should have stopped with the appetizers since they were plentiful and filling. I ordered the Bibimbap because I liked the way the name sounded. This mixture of veggies, meat comes with an egg on top. I asked the server to cook the egg with a hard yolk which may explain why the whole dish seemed over cooked and dry since it had to be returned to the kitchen.  A friend had Chicken fried rice and said it was delicious. Hot tea was served on a separate tray, an individual pot with a flower design and matching cup. Service was attentive. I would/will return.

data.title: Korean cuisine - the best in Evansvilke
data.text:
This winter we visited Jaya's Restaurant prior to a hockey game downtown. We tried the Chop Chae with chicken and the Kimchi with tofu. Both of these entrées were very good: uniquely tasteful, but not spicy hot. 
    Our waitstaff was attentive and pleasant. It was a good visit for some not so ordinary food. We will look forward to another visit soon especially since it's close to our Ford Arena.

data.title: could have been a perfect score
data.text:
I will start with the negative. Only 1. The waitress. IMO the most important part of your restaurant, and if you have good ones, pay them more, they are worth it. Not going to list item by item, lets just say there were many, and not just from this one server. Jaya, you may need to shake up your staff.
Lets get to the Good! Easy to get to with ample parking in downtown Evansville. Close enough to walk to many attractions. Just off the "Main" drag of main street. Inside, very nice furnishings, a lot of space, not right next to the other diners. I was disappointed on a Monday at lunch this place was not packed with locals. I know 20 years ago there would have been lawyers and medical staff a plenty here. But there were not many this day.
Many choices of hot tea. We had a party of 5. We had 3 different teas. All great, but not hot enough, the green tea did not steep do to the water temp.
We had fried calamari (very tender, lightly breaded) and sushi for appetizers. Sushi looks to be a hit here, I may go back alone just to try some more.
WE had a few vegetarian dishes, some soups, the vegetable we had tofu added, it was very good. The vegetable fried rice was great, as was the stir fried veggies. We also had all of our egg role made veg only. Normally it is chicken egg roll.
My mother eventually got her order made without spices. I like mine hot, she does not even want black pepper. But the waitress could not understand that, and had it mad mild, which still had red and black pepper in the Stir fried shrimp. Large luxurious shrimp with tender veggies, one the seasoning was right, she really liked it.
I had Pul Ko Kee, a beef stir fry with veg and black mushrooms. I ordered it hot, it was spicy, but not near overwhelming. Very good.
This was moms birthday, so Jaya brought out a piece of orange mandarin cake with a candle. It was very moist and very good as well.

data.title: Average
data.text: This was my first time to Jaya's. I have a favorite Korean BBQ restaurant in Lexington, KY called Arirang Gardens, therefore I am spoiled by the quality of their food. The food here was average. The meat tasted like it was a day old and also didn't taste like it was marinaded which is a traditional practice in Korean cuisine. Other than that, the service was good and I might come back another time to try something different.

data.title: Good food, but why does it take so long to get it??
data.text: I like the good and the ambiance is nice. But I can have more attentive and personable service elsewhere, more updated atmosphere elsewhere, and there are easier to reach locations. But if I am downtown at lunch with plenty of time to kill I will be back.

data.title: Just average
data.text: Met a friend here for lunch during the week, had always wanted to eat here. I wasn't sure what to expect so had an open mind. I must say the egg drop soup was the best I've had. The cashew chicken I had was ok, nothing better or worse than I've had at other restaurants. May or may not be back.

data.title: Just average
data.text: My husband and I had dinner at Jaya's for the first time, even though its been open for a very long time. The menu is very thorough, with descriptions of all of the Korean dishes. I tried Jaya's Chicken and my husband tried a spicy BBQ pork dish I can't pronounce or spell. Both were good portion sizes but very average in taste and ingredients. My husband commented on the minimal pork in his and my chicken did not have much flavor. I did order it mild instead of medium or spicy. Overall the place is spacious and clean, and our server was helpful, but I would just say it was an average experience.

data.title: From a 7-Seater to It's Current Facility, Wonderful Korean
data.text: I knew Jaya's from when it was literally a seven-stool facility just off Main St.  Businessmen would stand behind diners to get a stool.  Her clean Korean dishes would bring me back time after time, as I worked just two blocks away...sometimes 3-4 times a week.  Today, Jaya has a full dining facility in the old F's Steakhouse building.  Her menu is greatly expanded, but the quality has never suffered.  I no longer work downtown, but when I am able to be in the area, I make a point of stopping here.  Owner Jaya Dodd continues to be personable and the ultimate host.  If you've never tried Korean food, know that it is unlike any other Asian cuisine you have tried.  My personal favorites are the Chop Chae, Mongolian Beef or Jaya's Chicken.
